{"body":"<p>I'm building a dashboard that will pull in data via an HTTP request. In order to get the data, I have to include date based &quot;start&quot; and &quot;end&quot; search params in the URL, so I decided to use URLSearchParams to allow this to be somewhat dynamic.</p>\n<p>However, when I pass in the URLSearchParams into the final request they're getting altered. The basics layout of my code is as follows:</p>\n<pre><code>// create new date as of &quot;today&quot;, and one week previous\nconst today = new Date()\nconst prevWeek = new Date(today.valueOf() - (86400000 * 7))\n\n// get dates in UTC format for use in params\nfunction getUTCDate(date) {\n  const utcDay = date.toISOString()\n  return utcDay\n}\n\n// creating params based on dates\nconst paramObj = {start: getUTCDate(prevWeek), end: getUTCDate(today)}\nconst params = new URLSearchParams(paramObj)\n\n// setting up URL for HTTP call\nconst mailboxUrl = new URL(`https://api.helpscout.net/v2/reports/email?${params}`)\nconst config = {headers: {authorization: &quot;&quot;}}\n</code></pre>\n<p>If I log <code>params</code> I get <code>URLSearchParams { 'start' =&gt; '2020-11-17T21:59:20.459Z', 'end' =&gt; '2020-11-10T21:59:20.459Z' }</code> which has the correct formatting.</p>\n<p>However when logging the final <code>URL</code> I get <code>'https://api.helpscout.net/v2/reports/email?start=2020-11-17T21%3A58%3A52.627Z&amp;end=2020-11-10T21%3A58%3A52.627Z'</code></p>\n<p>Basically the colons are getting replaced with ISO character codes... but I'm not exactly sure why that is. {"body":"<p>I am trying to use CGAL within a webpage by compiling it into web assembly. Right now I am just messing around and trying to understand what the possibilities are.</p>\n<p>I was worried about the speed of CGAL so I made a little benchmark to understand how fast the library is.</p>\n<pre><code>Nef_polyhedron N1(P);\nNef_polyhedron initial(P);\nfor(int i = 0; i &lt; 4; i++){\n    for(int j = 0; j &lt; 4; j++){\n        for(int k = 0; k &lt; 4; k++){\n            printf(&quot;i:  %i\\n&quot;, i);\n            Nef_polyhedron N2(initial);\n            N2 = translate(N2,2*i,2*j,2*k);\n            N1 += N2;\n        }\n    }\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>Which generates a cube of cubes like this:</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/k8dXV.png\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"><img src=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/k8dXV.png\" alt=\"Cube of cubes benchmark\" /></a></p>\n<p>When I compile that code locally into a .exe file the execution time is fantastic ~3 seconds which is perfect for what I want.</p>\n<p>However when I compile the code into WebAssembly and run it in a browser it takes 143 seconds to run which is long. I expect somewhat of a performance hit when going to WebAssembly, but that seems huge.</p>\n<p>Can anyone help me understand what is going on? I appreciate any thoughts anyone has.</p>\n<p>I am using the simple Cartesian kernel and I am interested in doing boolean operations. Here is my complete code:</p>\n<pre><code>\n#include &lt;stdio.h&gt;\n#include &lt;stdlib.h&gt;\n#include &lt;time.h&gt;\n#include &lt;emscripten.h&gt;\n\n#include &lt;CGAL/Simple_cartesian.h&gt;\n#include &lt;CGAL/polygon_mesh_processing.h&gt;\n#include &lt;CGAL/Polyhedron_3.h&gt;\n#include &lt;CGAL/Nef_polyhedron_3.h&gt;\n#include &lt;iostream&gt;\n\ntypedef CGAL::Simple_cartesian&lt;double&gt;     Kernel;\ntypedef CGAL::Polyhedron_3&lt;Kernel&gt;         Polyhedron;\ntypedef Kernel::Point_3                    Point_3;\ntypedef Polyhedron::Halfedge_handle        Halfedge_handle;\ntypedef Polyhedron::Vertex_iterator        Vertex_iterator;\ntypedef Polyhedron::Facet_iterator                   Facet_iterator;\ntypedef Polyhedron::Halfedge_around_facet_circulator Halfedge_facet_circulator;\ntypedef CGAL::Nef_polyhedron_3&lt;Kernel&gt; Nef_polyhedron;\ntypedef Kernel::Vector_3  Vector_3;\ntypedef Kernel::Aff_transformation_3  Aff_transformation_3;\n\n\ntemplate &lt;class Poly&gt;\ntypename Poly::Halfedge_handle make_cube_3( Poly&amp; P) {\n    // appends a cube of size [0,1]^3 to the polyhedron P.\n    CGAL_precondition( P.is_valid());\n    typedef typename Poly::Point_3         Point;\n    typedef typename Poly::Halfedge_handle Halfedge_handle;\n    Halfedge_handle h = P.make_tetrahedron( Point( 1, 0, 0),\n                                            Point( 0, 0, 1),\n                                            Point( 0, 0, 0),\n                                            Point( 0, 1, 0));\n    Halfedge_handle g = h-&gt;next()-&gt;opposite()-&gt;next();             // Fig. (a)\n    P.split_edge( h-&gt;next());\n    P.split_edge( g-&gt;next());\n    P.split_edge( g);                                              // Fig. (b)\n    h-&gt;next()-&gt;vertex()-&gt;point()     = Point( 1, 0, 1);\n    g-&gt;next()-&gt;vertex()-&gt;point()     = Point( 0, 1, 1);\n    g-&gt;opposite()-&gt;vertex()-&gt;point() = Point( 1, 1, 0);            // Fig. (c)\n    Halfedge_handle f = P.split_facet( g-&gt;next(),\n                                       g-&gt;next()-&gt;next()-&gt;next()); // Fig. (d)\n    Halfedge_handle e = P.split_edge( f);\n    e-&gt;vertex()-&gt;point() = Point( 1, 1, 1);                        // Fig. (e)\n    P.split_facet( e, f-&gt;next()-&gt;next());                          // Fig. (f)\n    CGAL_postcondition( P.is_valid());\n    return h;\n}\n\n\nfloat displayBuffer[1000];\n\nNef_polyhedron translate(Nef_polyhedron shape, int x, int y, int z){\n    \n    Aff_transformation_3 aff(CGAL::TRANSLATION, Vector_3(x, y, z));\n    shape.transform(aff);\n    \n    return shape;\n}\n\nextern &quot;C&quot;\n{\n\nint displayShape(){\n    \n    time_t start, end; \n    start = time(NULL);\n    \n    Polyhedron P;\n    Halfedge_handle h = make_cube_3( P);\n    \n    Nef_polyhedron N1(P);\n    Nef_polyhedron initial(P);\n    \n    for(int i = 0; i &lt; 2; i++){\n        for(int j = 0; j &lt; 2; j++){\n            for(int k = 0; k &lt; 2; k++){\n                printf(&quot;i:  %i\\n&quot;, i);\n                Nef_polyhedron N2(initial);\n                N2 = translate(N2,2*i,2*j,2*k);\n                N1 += N2;\n            }\n        }\n    }\n    \n    Polyhedron P2;\n    N1.convert_to_polyhedron(P2);\n    \n    \n    printf(&quot;Facets before: %lu\\n&quot;, P2.size_of_facets());\n    \n    CGAL::Polygon_mesh_processing::triangulate_faces(P2);\n    \n    printf(&quot;Facets after: %lu\\n&quot;, P2.size_of_facets());\n    \n    end = time(NULL); \n    printf(&quot;Time compute cube is %.2f seconds\\n&quot;, difftime(end, start)); \n    \n    int index = 0;\n    \n    for (  Facet_iterator i = P2.facets_begin(); i != P2.facets_end(); ++i) {\n        \n        Halfedge_facet_circulator j = i-&gt;facet_begin();\n        \n        Vertex_iterator v = j-&gt;vertex();\n        \n        displayBuffer[index] = v-&gt;point()[0];\n        displayBuffer[index+1] = v-&gt;point()[1];\n        displayBuffer[index+2] = v-&gt;point()[2];\n        \n        j++;\n        \n        Vertex_iterator w = j-&gt;vertex();\n        \n        displayBuffer[index+3] = w-&gt;point()[0];\n        displayBuffer[index+4] = w-&gt;point()[1];\n        displayBuffer[index+5] = w-&gt;point()[2];\n        \n        j++;\n        \n        Vertex_iterator x = j-&gt;vertex();\n        \n        displayBuffer[index+6] = x-&gt;point()[0];\n        displayBuffer[index+7] = x-&gt;point()[1];\n        displayBuffer[index+8] = x-&gt;point()[2];\n        \n        index = index + 9;\n    }\n    \n    return index;\n}\n\nfloat * getDisplayBufferAddress(){\n    return displayBuffer;\n}\n\n}\n\n\n// Init circle data and start render - JS\nint main(){\n\n    \n    printf(&quot;Loading new...\\n&quot;);\n    \n    EM_ASM({ init(); });\n    \n    \n    return 0;\n}\n\n\n</code></pre>\n<p><strong>Edit:</strong> Some information from profiling</p>\n<p>When I profile the loading process you can pretty clearly see the pattern of each cube processing and the process taking longer and longer as the shape gets more and more complex:</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/f21aV.png\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"><img src=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/f21aV.png\" alt=\"Profiling\" /></a></p>\n<p>Unfortunately there doesn't (at least to my eye) seem to be one particular function which is taking an unexpected amount of time...more that they are cumulatively taking longer than expected.</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":841,"question_id":64884051,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

                 \n        &lt;script type=&quot;text/javascript&quot;&gt; \n            var b=document.getElementById('angle').value;\n            var o=document.getElementById('vel').value;\n            var pro = {\n                x:50,\n                y:380,\n                r:15,\n                v:o,\n                theta:b,\n                };              \n                var canvas = document.getElementById('surface');\n                var ctx = canvas.getContext('2d');              \n                var frameCount = 0;\n                var v0x = pro.v * Math.cos(pro.theta * Math.PI/180);\n                var v0y = pro.v * Math.sin(pro.theta * Math.PI/180);\n                var startX = pro.x;\n                var startY = pro.y;\n                var g = 9.8;\n                setInterval(function()\n                {\n                    ctx.save();\n                        ctx.fillStyle = &quot;rgba(256, 256, 256, .3)&quot;;\n                        ctx.fillRect(0, 0, canvas.width, canvas.height);\n                    ctx.restore();                  \n                    if(pro.y&lt;canvas.height - pro.r &amp;&amp; pro.x &lt; canvas.width - pro.r)\n                    {\n                        pro.y = startY - ( v0y * frameCount - (1/2 * g * Math.pow(frameCount,2)) );\n                        pro.x = startX + v0x * frameCount;\n                    }                       \n                    ctx.save();\n                        ctx.beginPath();\n                        ctx.fillStyle = &quot;rgba(200, 0, 0, 0.9)&quot;;\n                        ctx.arc(pro.x,pro.y,pro.r,0,Math.PI*2,true);\n                        ctx.fill();\n                        ctx.stroke();\n                        ctx.closePath();\n                    ctx.restore();\n                    frameCount+=.1;                     \n                }, 1000 / 77);              \n            function start()\n            {\n                pro.x = 50;\n                pro.y = 380;\n                pro.v = o;\n                pro.theta = b;\n                frameCount = 0;\n                v0x = pro.v * Math.cos(pro.theta * Math.PI/180);\n                v0y = pro.v * Math.sin(pro.theta * Math.PI/180);\n            }\n        &lt;/script&gt; I want to pause the song after a certain amount of time and so I set a timeout inside the async function to call another async function after the timeout ends. However every time I call the first play function the timeout for the second async function seems to grow for apparently no reason. My code:</p>\n<pre><code>let timeoutId\n\n...\n\nexport const playElement = (accessToken, songUri, refreshToken, start, duration, deviceId) =&gt; async (dispatch) =&gt; {\n  dispatch(loading());\n  clearTimeout(timeoutId)\n  timeoutId = setTimeout(async () =&gt; {\n    await dispatch(pausePlayer(accessToken, refreshToken, deviceId, songUri))\n    \n  }, duration*1000)\n\n \n  try { \n    const url = deviceId === '' ? '/me/player/play' : `/me/player/play?device_id=${deviceId}`;\n    await spotify.put(\n      url,\n      { position_ms: start * 1000, uris: [songUri] },\n\n      {\n        headers: {\n          Authorization: `Bearer ${accessToken}`,\n          Accept: 'application/json',\n          'Content-Type': 'application/json',\n        },\n      }\n    );\n    \n    dispatch({\n      type: PLAY,\n      playing: true,\n    })\n  } catch (error) {\n    dispatch(returnErrors(error));\n    if (error.response.status === 401) {\n      const newAccessToken = await dispatch(refreshAccessToken(refreshToken));\n      dispatch(playElement(newAccessToken, songUri, refreshToken, start, duration, deviceId));\n    }\n    if (error.response.status === 404) {\n      const newDeviceId = await dispatch(getDeviceId(accessToken));\n      dispatch(playElement(accessToken, songUri, refreshToken, start, duration, newDeviceId));\n    }\n  }\n  \n  dispatch(notLoading());\n\n};\n\nexport const pausePlayer = (accessToken, refreshToken, deviceId, songUri) =&gt;  async (dispatch, getState) =&gt; {\n  try { \n    let state = getState();\n    const url = deviceId === '' ? '/me/player/pause' : `/me/player/pause?device_id=${deviceId}`;\n    if (state.spotifyPlayer.playing &amp;&amp; state.spotifyPlayer.controlledPlay &amp;&amp; state.spotifyPlayer.song === songUri) { \n      await spotify.put( \n        url,\n        {}, {\n          headers: {\n            Authorization: `Bearer ${accessToken}`,\n          },\n        }\n      )\n  }\n    dispatch({\n      type: PAUSE,\n      payload: false\n    })\n\n    } catch (error) {\n      dispatch(returnErrors(error));\n      if (error.response.status === 401) {\n        const newAccessToken = await dispatch(refreshAccessToken(refreshToken));\n        dispatch(pausePlayer(newAccessToken, deviceId));\n      }\n      if (error.response.status === 404) {\n        const newDeviceId = await dispatch(getDeviceId(accessToken));\n        dispatch(pausePlayer(accessToken, newDeviceId));\n      }\n    }\n}\n\n</code></pre>\n","userId":1,"threadId":854,"question_id":64883763,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

{"body":"<p>I'm trying to create a mouse trail effect with threejs, basing it off of this example: <a href=\"https://medium.com/epicagency/behind-the-scenes-of-we-cargo-3999f5f559c\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">https://medium.com/epicagency/behind-the-scenes-of-we-cargo-3999f5f559c</a> (near the bottom of the page).</p>\n<p>I've been trying this for a few days now, but I cannot get the circle which is drawn with an intensity derived from the cursor speed and fades over time, to stay on the screen as is shown in the example on the link provided. Everything is working fine in terms of drawing the circle based on cursor delta, but I cannot figure out how to actually keep the trail on screen. The circle only is drawn where the cursor is and all trails are erased on each animation frame. I've tried setting the canvas alpha to 0, I've tried using a FBO and using the mouse trail as an intermediate render target, I've tried hijacking the render function in the middle of the RAF hook (I'm using React Three Fiber), and I keep getting the same results. I'm not using the bidello helper class that the author is using, maybe there is some subtle thing that I'm missing in those helper classes that is the secret sauce... I don't know.</p>\n<p>Plane.js</p>\n<pre><code>const Geometry = props =&gt; {\n\n    const width = window.innerWidth\n    const height = window.innerHeight\n\n    const pointer = new THREE.Vector2()\n    let speed = 0\n\n    const uniforms = useMemo(\n        () =&gt; ({\n            u_mouse: { value: new THREE.Vector2() },\n            u_speed: {\n                value: 0,\n            },\n            u_time: { value: 0.0 },\n            u_resolution: { value: { x: width, y: height } },\n            u_ratio: {\n                value: window.innerWidth / window.innerHeight,\n            },\n            u_texture: {\n                value: new THREE.DataTexture(\n                    new Float32Array(width * height * 4),\n                    width,\n                    height\n                ),\n            },\n        }),\n        []\n    )\n\n    var diff = new MouseSpeed()\n    diff.init()\n\n    const pointerMove = e =&gt; {\n        pointer.set(e.x / window.innerWidth, 1 - e.y / window.innerHeight)\n\n        pointer.x = (e.clientX / window.innerWidth) * 2 - 1\n        pointer.y = -(e.clientY / window.innerHeight) * 2 + 1\n\n        uniforms.u_mouse.value.x = pointer.x\n        uniforms.u_mouse.value.y = pointer.y\n    }\n\n    useFrame((state, delta) =&gt; {\n        uniforms.u_time.value += delta\n\n        uniforms.u_mouse.value.lerp(pointer, 0.2)\n        uniforms.u_speed.value = speed\n        // state.gl.render(state.scene, state.camera)\n        // state.gl.setClearColor(0x000000, 0)\n\n        const diffSpeed =\n            Math.max(Math.abs(diff.speedX), Math.abs(diff.speedY)) * 0.05\n        speed += diffSpeed\n        speed *= 0.9\n    })\n\n    return (\n        &lt;&gt;\n            {/* {createPortal(&lt;Trail /&gt;, scene)} */} // This was used when I was using an FBO\n            &lt;mesh onPointerMove={pointerMove}&gt;\n                &lt;planeBufferGeometry args={[width, height, 1, 1]} /&gt;\n                &lt;shaderMaterial\n                    uniforms={uniforms}\n                    vertexShader={mainVert}\n                    fragmentShader={mainFrag}\n                    onUpdate={self =&gt; (self.needsUpdate = true)}\n                /&gt;\n            &lt;/mesh&gt;\n        &lt;/&gt;\n    )\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>shader.frag</p>\n<pre><code>uniform vec2 u_resolution;\nuniform vec3 u_mouse;\nuniform float u_time;\nuniform float u_ratio;\nuniform float u_speed;\nuniform sampler2D u_texture;\n\nvoid main() {\n    vec2 uv = gl_FragCoord.xy / u_resolution.xy;\n    vec4 color = texture2D(u_texture, v_uv + vec2(0.0, -0.002));\n    \n    vec2 center = (u_mouse.xy) / 2. + .5;\n    uv.x *= u_ratio;\n    center.x *= u_ratio;\n    \n    color.r += circle(uv, center, 0.0, .08) * u_speed;\n    color.r = mix(color.r, 0.0, .009);\n    color.r = clamp(color.r, 0.0, 1.0);\n    \n    color.g = color.r;\n    \n    gl_FragColor = color;\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>Basically I'm just wondering what I have to do to get this working like the mouse trail animation in the example that I provided. {"body":"<p>I was creating a <code>useReduxState</code> hook, which made use of Redux's <code>useSelector</code> and lodash's <code>pick</code> module. I've simplified my approach for the sake of brevity for this question. Here is what I have:</p>\n<pre><code>interface IReducerA {\n    loading: boolean\n}\n\ninterface IReducerB {\n    open: boolean\n}\n\ntype TGetReducerState = IReducerA &amp; IReducerB;\n\ninterface IState {\n    reducerA: IReducerA;\n    reducerB: IReducerB;\n}\n\nconst state = {\n    reducerA: { loading: false; },\n    reducerB: { open: true; }\n}\n\nconst getState = (reducer: keyof IState, values: Array&lt;keyof TGetReducerState&gt;): TGetReducerState =&gt; pick(state, values);\n\nconst { loading } = getState('reducerA', ['loading'])\n</code></pre>\n<p>I've managed to get this working (kind of). The last line,</p>\n<pre><code>const { loading } = getState('reducerA', ['loading'])\n</code></pre>\n<p>correctly suggested <code>'loading'</code> as one of the entries to <code>values: Array&lt;keyof TGetReducerState&gt;</code> and it correctly suggests <code>'loading'</code> as one the return values.</p>\n<p>The problem here, is that Typescript would not complain about the following line:</p>\n<pre><code>const { loading } = getState('reducerA', ['open'])\n</code></pre>\n<p>There are two problems with this line. The first is that the property <code>'open'</code> does not exist in <code>reducerA</code> and the second problem is that if I request <code>'open'</code>, then I shouldn't be able to destructure <code>const { loading } = . . .</code>.</p>\n<p>How can I properly type this?</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://www.typescriptlang.org/play?#\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">Here</a> is my approach.</p>\n<h1>Edit</h1>\n<p>Writing here, because it's too long for the comment section.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://stackoverflow.com/a/64884185/2891356\">This</a> approach <a href=\"https://www.typescriptlang.org/play?ssl=34&amp;ssc=9&amp;pln=34&amp;pc=16#\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">doesn't work</a></p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":868,"question_id":64883362,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>I'm converting my express server to typescript and I'm having trouble with a type error. Below is a search function using mongoose. It takes a RegExp, and then calls <code>Model.find()</code>.</p>\n<pre><code>export const search = async (req: Request, res: Response): Promise&lt;void&gt; =&gt; {\n  const { value } = req.query;\n  if (typeof value === 'string') {\n    const regExp = new RegExp(value, 'i');\n    try {\n      const results = await Product.find({ $text: { $search: regExp } }).exec();\n    // etc.\n    }\n</code></pre>\n<p>The error is on <code>$search</code> and says <code>No overload matches this call. {\n  const [filterQuery, setFilterQuery] = useState(&quot;&quot;);\n\n  const {\n    getTableProps,\n    getTableBodyProps,\n    headerGroups,\n    rows,\n    prepareRow,\n    setFilter,\n  } = useTable({ columns, data }, useFilters);\n\n  const handleFilterChange = (event) =&gt; {"body":"<p>I have <strong>2 different databases</strong>, on <strong>2 different servers</strong>, with <strong>2 different schemas</strong>.</p>\n<p>Essentially, I want to associate one table in one database to another table in the other database, though I am having some trouble in doing so. I've been able to create associations between 2 tables in 2 different databases, on the same server, having problems when they do not share the same host/server.</p>\n<p>I'm not entirely sure this is even possible but I hope there is a way around it?</p>\n<p>Below is my architecture, outlining the <strong>2 servers</strong>, <strong>2 databases</strong> and outling the association between <code>property</code> &amp; <code>favourites</code></p>\n<pre><code>    +--------------------+--------------------+\n    | Server-1           |           Server-2 |\n    +--------------------+--------------------+\n    | Database-1         |         Database-2 |\n    +--------------------+--------------------+\n    | property  &lt;----------------- favourites |\n    | user               |         notes      |\n    | account            |                    |\n    +--------------------+--------------------+\n</code></pre>\n<p>I followed <a href=\"https://medium.com/unetiq/using-multiple-databases-with-nodejs-and-sequelize-59e0abcbbe6f\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">this article</a> as a starting place, though it, unfortunately, does not cover my use case.</p>\n<p>Here is my config, defining options grabbed from and environment file</p>\n<h2>config.js</h2>\n<pre><code>import accessEnv from &quot;../utils/accessEnv&quot;;\nimport logger from &quot;../utils/logger&quot;;\n\nconst defaultOptions = {\n  dialect: &quot;mysql&quot;,\n  logging: msg =&gt; logger.debug(msg)\n};\n\nmodule.exports = {\n  /**Declaration of databases for my development environment**/\n  &quot;development&quot;: {\n    &quot;databases&quot;: {\n      &quot;Database1&quot;: {\n        &quot;database&quot;: accessEnv(&quot;DB&quot;),\n        &quot;username&quot;: accessEnv(&quot;DB_USERNAME&quot;),\n        &quot;password&quot;: accessEnv(&quot;DB_PASS&quot;),\n        &quot;host&quot;: accessEnv(&quot;DB_HOST&quot;),\n        &quot;port&quot;: accessEnv(&quot;DB_PORT&quot;),\n        ...defaultOptions\n      },\n      &quot;Database2&quot;: {\n        &quot;database&quot;: accessEnv(&quot;DB2&quot;),\n        &quot;username&quot;: accessEnv(&quot;DB2_USERNAME&quot;),\n        &quot;password&quot;: accessEnv(&quot;DB2_PASS&quot;),\n        &quot;host&quot;: accessEnv(&quot;DB2_HOST&quot;),\n        &quot;port&quot;: accessEnv(&quot;DB2_PORT&quot;),\n        ...defaultOptions\n      },\n    },\n  }\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>in my sequelize generated <code>index.js</code> for my models, I have updated it a little, based upon <a href=\"https://medium.com/unetiq/using-multiple-databases-with-nodejs-and-sequelize-59e0abcbbe6f\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">thie article</a> listed above to handle 2 different database connections.</p>\n<h2>models/index.js</h2>\n<pre><code>const fs = require('fs');\nconst path = require('path');\nconst Sequelize = require('sequelize');\nconst { default: logger } = require('../utils/logger');\nconst basename = path.basename(module.filename);\nconst env = process.env.NODE_ENV || 'development';\nconst config = require(`${__dirname}/../config/config.js`)[env];\nconst db = {};\nconst databases = Object.keys(config.databases);\n\n/** Add Databases**/\nfor (let i = 0; i &lt; databases.length; ++i) {\n  let database = databases[i];\n  let dbPath = config.databases[database];\n  db[database] = new Sequelize(dbPath.database, dbPath.username, dbPath.password, dbPath);\n  // Authenticate db connection\n  db[database].authenticate()\n    .then(() =&gt; logger.log(`${dbPath.database} connection successful!`))\n    .catch((err) =&gt; logger.log(err.stack));\n  // Allow schemas\n  db[database].dialect.supports.schemas = true;\n}\n\n/**Add the Database Models**/\n// Add models from database1 folder\nfs\n  .readdirSync(__dirname + '/database1')\n  .filter(file =&gt;\n    (file.indexOf('.') !== 0) &amp;&amp;\n    (file !== basename) &amp;&amp;\n    (file.slice(-3) === '.js'))\n  .forEach(file =&gt; {\n    const model = require(path.join(__dirname + '/database1', file))(db.Database1, Sequelize.DataTypes);\n    db[model.name] = model;\n  });\n\n// Add models from database2 folder\n fs\n  .readdirSync(__dirname + '/database2')\n  .filter(file =&gt;\n    (file.indexOf('.') !== 0) &amp;&amp;\n    (file !== basename) &amp;&amp;\n    (file.slice(-3) === '.js'))\n  .forEach(file =&gt; {\n    const model = require(path.join(__dirname + '/database2', file))(db.Database2, Sequelize.DataTypes);\n    db[model.name] = model;\n  });\n\nObject.keys(db).forEach(modelName =&gt; {\n  if (db[modelName].associate) {\n    db[modelName].associate(db);\n  }\n});\n\nmodule.exports = db;\n</code></pre>\n<p>Now for the models themselves.</p>\n<ul>\n<li><code>Property</code> is in one server with the <code>Database1</code> config.</li>\n<li><code>Favourites</code> is in another server with the <code>Database2</code> config.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>A <code>Favourites</code> will have one <code>Property</code>, associating by a <code>foreignKey</code> of <code>propertyId</code> in the <code>Favourites</code> model to <code>id</code> of <code>Property</code> model.</p>\n<h2>models/database1/Property.js</h2>\n<pre><code>module.exports = (sequelize, DataTypes) =&gt; {\n  const Property = sequelize.define(&quot;Property&quot;, {\n    id: {\n      type: DataTypes.INTEGER(11),\n      primaryKey: true,\n      allowNull: false,\n      autoIncrement: true\n    },\n    accountNumber: {\n      type: DataTypes.STRING(9),\n      allowNull: false,\n    }\n  }, {\n    schema: &quot;property_demo&quot;,\n    tableName: &quot;property&quot;,\n  });\n  Property.associate = (models) =&gt; {\n    Property.hasOne(models.Favourites, {\n      as: 'favourites',\n      foreignKey: 'propertyId'\n    });\n  };\n  return Property;\n};\n</code></pre>\n<h2>models/database2/Favourites.js</h2>\n<pre><code>module.exports = (sequelize, DataTypes) =&gt; {\n  const Favourites = sequelize.define(&quot;Favourites&quot;, {\n    id: {\n      type: DataTypes.INTEGER(),\n      primaryKey: true,\n      allowNull: false,\n      autoIncrement: true\n    },\n    propertyId: {\n      type: DataTypes.INTEGER(11),\n      allowNull: false,\n    }\n  }, {\n    schema: &quot;shortlists&quot;,\n    tableName: &quot;favourites&quot;\n  });\n  Favourites.associate = (models) =&gt; {\n    Favourites.belongsTo(models.Property, {\n      as: 'property',\n      foreignKey: 'propertyId'\n    });\n  };\n  return Favourites;\n};\n</code></pre>\n<p>Now, for where the issue lies. When I try to <code>include</code> the <code>Property</code> model in a <code>Favourites</code> model query like below</p>\n<pre><code>import catchAsync from &quot;../utils/catchAsync&quot;;\nimport Models, { Favourites } from &quot;../models&quot;;\n\nexport const getFavourites = catchAsync(async (req, res, next) =&gt; {\n  const favourites = await Favourites.findAll({\n    include: [\n      {\n        model: Models.Property,\n        as: 'property',\n      }\n    ]\n  });\n  \n  return res.status(200).json({\n    status: 'success',\n    data: favourites\n  });\n\n});\n</code></pre>\n<p>I get the following error</p>\n<pre><code>&quot;error&quot;: {\n  &quot;name&quot;: &quot;SequelizeDatabaseError&quot;,\n  &quot;parent&quot;: {\n    &quot;code&quot;: &quot;ER_BAD_DB_ERROR&quot;,\n    &quot;errno&quot;: 1049,\n    &quot;sqlState&quot;: &quot;42000&quot;,\n    &quot;sqlMessage&quot;: &quot;Unknown database 'property_demo'&quot;\n  }\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>I get that it's looking for <code>property_demo</code> on <code>Server-2</code> as the <code>Favourites</code> model is based on <code>Server-2</code> despite <code>Property</code> model is in the <code>property_demo</code> schema on <code>Server-1</code> but is there a way around this so it filters on the correct server/host here?</p>\n<p>Any help would be greatly appreciated.</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":878,"question_id":64883120,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

{"body":"<p>So, I have this algorithm for mergeSort but cant seem to get it to work within JS. I'm getting maximum call stack exceeded when trying to run it and i cannot figure out why. Any help would be greatly appreciated.</p>\n<pre><code>export const doMergeSort = (array) =&gt; {\n    const mergeSort = arr =&gt; {\n        \n        let mid = Math.floor(arr.length / 2),\n            left = mergeSort(arr.slice(0, mid)),\n            right = mergeSort(arr.slice(mid));\n      \n        return merge(left, right);\n      };\n\n    const merge = (arr1, arr2) =&gt; {\n        let sorted = [];\n      \n        while (arr1.length &amp;&amp; arr2.length) {\n          if (arr1[0] &lt; arr2[0]) sorted.push(arr1.shift());\n          else sorted.push(arr2.shift());\n        };\n      \n        sorted.concat(arr1.slice().concat(arr2.slice()));\n      };\n\n      mergeSort(array);\n      \n      \n}\n</code></pre>\n","userId":1,"threadId":888,"question_id":64882852,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

{"body":"<pre class=\"lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>let _board = [[null, null, null], [null, null, null], [null, null, null]];\n   let _flag = true;\n   let _AIrowIndex = null;\n   let _AIcellIndex = null;\n   const _wrapper = document.querySelector(&quot;.wrapper&quot;);\n\n   const _changeTurn = function () {\n       if (_flag == true) {\n           _flag = false;\n           return playerOne.getSign();\n       } else {\n           _flag = true;\n           return playerTwo.getSign();\n       }\n   };\n\n   const _displayTurn = function () {\n       let turn = document.querySelector(&quot;.playerInfo__turn&quot;)\n       if (_flag == true) {\n           turn.innerHTML = `${playerOne.getName()} is your turn`;\n       } else {\n           turn.innerHTML = `${playerTwo.getName()} is your turn`;\n       }\n   };\n\n   \n   const _evaluation = (winner) =&gt; {\n           if(winner == &quot;X&quot;){\n               return 1;\n           }else if(winner == &quot;O&quot;){\n               return -1;\n           }\n           else{\n               return null;\n           }\n   };\n\n   const _evaluationFunction = function (board) {\n               /*CHECK 1 DIAG*/\n           if (board[0][0] === board[1][1] &amp;&amp; board[2][2] === board[0][0]) {\n               return _evaluation(board[0][0]);\n               /*CHECK 2 DIAG*/\n           } \n           if (board[0][2] === board[1][1] &amp;&amp; board[2][0] === board[0][2]) {\n               return _evaluation(board[0][2]);\n               /*CHECK PAIR*/\n           } \n           for (let col = 0; col &lt; 3; col++) {\n               if (board[0][col] === board[1][col] &amp;&amp; board[1][col] === board[2][col]) {\n                   return _evaluation(board[0][col]);\n               }\n           }\n           for (let row = 0; row &lt; 3; row++) {\n               if (board[row][0] === board[row][1] &amp;&amp; board[row][1] === board[row][2]) {\n                   return _evaluation(board[row][0]);\n               }\n           }\n           return 0;        \n   };\n\n   const minimax = (_board, depth, isMaximizer) =&gt; {\n\n       let result = _evaluationFunction(_board);\n       console.log(result);\n       if (result !== null) {\n           return result;\n       }\n\n       if (isMaximizer) {\n           let bestScore = -Infinity;\n\n           for (let i = 0; i &lt; 3; i++) {\n               for (let j = 0; j &lt; 3; j++) {\n                   if (_board[i][j] == null) {\n                       _board[i][j] = playerOne.getSign();\n                       let score = minimax(_board, depth + 1, false);\n                       _board[i][j] = null;\n                       bestScore = Math.max(score, bestScore);\n                   }\n               }\n\n           }\n           return bestScore;\n\n       } else {\n           let bestScore = Infinity;\n\n           for (let i = 0; i &lt; 3; i++) {\n               for (let j = 0; j &lt; 3; j++) {\n                   if (_board[i][j] == null) {\n                       _board[i][j] = playerTwo.getSign();\n                       let score = minimax(_board, depth + 1, true);\n                       _board[i][j] = null;\n                       bestScore = Math.min(score, bestScore);\n                   }\n               }\n           }\n           return bestScore;\n       }\n   };\n   \n   const _setAIPlay = () =&gt; {\n       \n       let bestScore = Infinity;\n       let bestMove;\n\n       for (let i = 0; i &lt; 3; i++) {\n           for (let j = 0; j &lt; 3; j++) {\n               if (_board[i][j] == null) {\n                   _board[i][j] = playerTwo.getSign();\n                   let score = minimax(_board, 0, true);       \n                   _board[i][j] = null;\n                   if(score &lt; bestScore){\n                       bestScore = score;\n                       console.log(bestScore);\n                       bestMove = {i, j}\n                   }\n               }\n           }\n       };\n\n       _board[bestMove.i][bestMove.j] = playerTwo.getSign();\n       _AIrowIndex = bestMove.i;\n       _AIcellIndex = bestMove.j;\n       _displayAIPlay(_AIrowIndex, _AIcellIndex);\n       _changeTurn();\n       _checkWinner();\n   };\n\n   \n\n\n   const _displayAIPlay = (rowIndex, cellIndex) =&gt; {\n       let AIcell = document.querySelector(`[data-row=&quot;${rowIndex}&quot;][data-cell=&quot;${cellIndex}&quot;]`);\n       AIcell.textContent = playerTwo.getSign();\n   }\n</code></pre>\n<p>I am trying to solve this tic-tac-toe problem with the minimax algorithm but I don't understand why it continues to place the &quot;O&quot; {"body":"<p>directory structure</p>\n<p>|_ jwks.json<br />\n|_ cube.js<br />\n|_ package.json</p>\n<p>The cube <a href=\"https://cube.dev/docs/config\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">docs give config for cube.js</a>:</p>\n<pre class=\"lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>const fs = require(&quot;fs&quot;);\nconst jwt = require(&quot;jsonwebtoken&quot;);\nconst jwkToPem = require(&quot;jwk-to-pem&quot;);\nconst jwks = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(&quot;jwks.json&quot;));\nconst _ = require(&quot;lodash&quot;);\n\nmodule.exports = {\n  checkAuth: async (req, auth) =&gt; {\n    const decoded = jwt.decode(auth, { complete: true });\n    const jwk = _.find(jwks.keys, x =&gt; x.kid === decoded.header.kid);\n    const pem = jwkToPem(jwk);\n    req.authInfo = jwt.verify(auth, pem);\n  },\n  contextToAppId: ({ authInfo }) =&gt; `APP_${authInfo.userId}`,\n  preAggregationsSchema: ({ authInfo }) =&gt; &quot;pre_aggregations_${authInfo.userId}&quot;\n};\n</code></pre>\n<p><strong>Question:</strong> If this is the model used (image below) how does one initialize the process to acquire a token. {"body":"<p>I am using <code>updateContents</code> to insert the delta for an iframe for a video, and would like to enter the iframe delta where the cursor is. However, right now the iframe is always inserted at the top of the editor using <code>updateContents</code>.</p>\n<p><strong>Steps for Reproduction</strong></p>\n<p>Here is the code for it -</p>\n<pre><code>                  const addVideoRange = this.editor.getSelection();\n                  const newRange = addVideoRange !== null ? addVideoRange.index : 0;\n                  // get the iFrame\n                  const safeHtml = this.embedService.embed(url, {\n                    attr: { width: 600, height: 400 },\n                  });\n                  // converting safeHTML to Delta to insert into the Quill editor\n                  const delta = this.editor.clipboard.convert(safeHtml.changingThisBreaksApplicationSecurity);\n                  // &quot;silent&quot; source so selection-change event is not emitted\n                  this.editor.updateContents(delta, 'silent');\n                  this.editor.setSelection(1 + newRange);\n</code></pre>\n<p>Here is how I want it to work (<code>insertEmbed</code> embeds the video where the cursor is) -</p>\n<pre><code>                  const addVideoRange = this.editor.getSelection();\n                  const newRange = addVideoRange !== null ? addVideoRange.index : 0;\n                  this.editor.insertEmbed(newRange, 'video', url);\n                  this.editor.setSelection(1 + newRange);\n</code></pre>\n<p><strong>Expected behavior</strong>: For the video iFrame to be embedded where the cursor is, the way insertEmbed works.</p>\n<p><strong>Actual behavior</strong>: The iFrame is embedded in the beginning of the document.</p>\n<p>Note that I cannot use insertEmbed because I have to insert html/delta.</p>\n<p><strong>Version</strong>: 1.3.7</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":905,"question_id":64882648,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>I'm looking for a solution to this problem, I need to put a number between 0 and 5 inclusively and it must output an array of 5 elements,\nFor example, if I put 5 I must get [100, 100, 100, 100, 100]</p>\n<p>Examples:\ncreateStars(3.5) // [100, 100, 100, 50, 0]\ncreateStars(1.6667) // [100, 66.67, 0, 0, 0]</p>\n<p>This is my attempt at it</p>\n<pre class=\"lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>function numberStars(number) {\n  var array = [];\n  if (number &gt; 0 &amp;&amp; number &lt;= 5) {\n    for (i = 0; i &lt; 5; i++) {\n      var multiplied = number * 100;\n      remainder = multiplied % 100;\n      array.push(remainder);\n      multiplied = remainder;\n    }\n  }\n  return array;\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>it gives back [60, 60, 60, 60, 60]</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":907,"question_id":64882627,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>I have a service worker that should return a cached file if it's of a certain type. If not, it should fetch the resource. I put the code that checks if the file is a certain type inside the fetch function. If it is, it returns the cached version. If not, it returns the fetched version. I have found out though, that it sends a network request for the fetch, then returns the cached version (duh).</p>\n<p>I don't want this because it undos the purpose of serving the cached version of a large file instead of fetching it if possible. I realized I have to put the if then statement outside of the fetch, but that would mean that I am putting it in as a parameter. This is a problem, because it throws an error. So, I decided to put it inside a function. This returns an invalid response, so I don't know what I am doing wrong. It must be that the function inside the event.respondWith() must not be returning, but why?</p>\n<p>My code is:</p>\n<pre><code>this.addEventListener(&quot;fetch&quot;, function (event) {\n    event.respondWith(function(){\n        //if the event request is a music file (I have it stored in a folder named music, so if the request is like &quot;music/musicfile.mp3&quot;), then returned the cached version. If not, fetch the file over the network. \n        if(event.request.url.match(/music\\//)){\n            return caches.match(event.request).then(function(r){\n                if(r){\n                    return r;\n                }\n                else{\n                    return fetch(event.request).then(function(fetchR){\n                        return fetchR;\n                    });\n                }\n            });\n        }\n        else{\n            return fetch(event.request).then(function(res){\n                return res;\n            }).catch(function(){\n                return caches.match(event.request).then(function(cacheRes){\n                    if(cacheRes){\n                        return cacheRes;\n                    }\n                    else{\n                        return new Response(&quot;Error&quot;,{status : 520, statusText : &quot;Error fetching cache&quot;, headers :new Headers({&quot;Content-Type&quot;:&quot;text/html&quot;})});\n                    }\n                });\n            });\n        }\n    }\n    );\n});\n</code></pre>\n<p>I know this is probably not the best approach, but if there is another way I would gladly like to improve it for best practices.</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":906,"question_id":64882629,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

JSON.parse(objArray) : objArray;\n    \n    var str =\n      `${Object.keys(arr[0])\n        .map((value) =&gt; `&quot;${value}&quot;`)\n        .join(',')}` + '\\r\\n';\n    var csvContent = arr.reduce((st, next) =&gt; {\n      console.log(next);\n      st +=\n        `${Object.values(next)\n          .map((value) =&gt; `&quot;${value}&quot;`)\n          .join(',')}` + '\\r\\n';\n      return st;\n    }, str);\n    var element = document.createElement('a');\n    element.href = 'data:text/csv;charset=utf-8,' + encodeURI(csvContent);\n    element.target = '_blank';\n    element.download = 'export.csv';\n    element.click();\n  }\n</code></pre>\n","userId":1,"threadId":909,"question_id":64882582,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

{"body":"<p>Trying to create SharedWorker with <a href=\"https://github.com/webpack-contrib/worker-loader\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">worker-loader</a>\nIt doesnt create it, just Worker is created. Seems like it ignores options.</p>\n<p>Usage in parent code</p>\n<pre class=\"lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>import SharedWorker from &quot;worker-loader!./workers/get-nth-fibonacci-number.shared-worker.js&quot;;\n\nimport &quot;./styles/style.scss&quot;;\n\nconst btn = document.getElementById(&quot;calc-btn&quot;);\nconst input = document.getElementById(&quot;nth-input&quot;);\nconst result = document.getElementById(&quot;result-el&quot;);\n\nconst worker = new SharedWorker();\n\nconsole.log(&quot;worker&quot;, worker);\n\nworker.port.addEventListener(&quot;message&quot;, (e) =&gt; {\n  result.innerHTML = e.data;\n});\nworker.port.addEventListener(&quot;error&quot;, (e) =&gt; {\n  result.innerHTML = `message: ${e.message}; filename: ${e.filename}; line: ${e.lineno}`;\n  console.error(e);\n});\n\n//...\n</code></pre>\n<p>worker code</p>\n<pre class=\"lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>import { getNthFobonacciNumber } from &quot;../helpers/get-nth-fibonacci-number.js&quot;;\n\nconsole.log(&quot;hello from worker&quot;);\n\nself.addEventListener(&quot;connect&quot;, function (e) {\n  const port = e.ports[0];\n  console.log(&quot;port&quot;, port);\n  port.addEventListener(&quot;message&quot;, function (e) {\n    const num = e.data;\n    if (Number.isInteger(parseInt(num))) {\n      const result = getNthFobonacciNumber(num);\n      port.postMessage({ result, port });\n    } else {\n      throw new Error(&quot;Is not a number&quot;);\n    }\n  });\n  port.start();\n});\n\n</code></pre>\n<p>webpack rule</p>\n<pre><code>      {\n        test: /\\.shared-worker\\.(c|m)?js$/i,\n        loader: &quot;worker-loader&quot;,\n        options: {\n          worker: &quot;SharedWorker&quot;,\n        },\n      },\n</code></pre>\n<p>But in console it is shown as Worker class. {"body":"<p>I want to set the required attribute to the input when I click the checkbox above. And when I click another checkbox above required attribute must be removed. {"body":"<p>I use only a little part of Jquery code and I want to translate him</p>\n<pre><code>  $(&quot;html,body&quot;).animate(\n      {\n        scrollTop: sections[counter].offsetTop,\n        behavior: &quot;smooth&quot;,\n      },\n      800\n    );\n</code></pre>\n<p><code>Window.scrollTo()</code> doesn't work</p>\n<p>Full code</p>\n<pre><code>let delay = false;\n\nlet counter = 0;\n// let scrollHeight = 0;\n\nconst sections = document.querySelectorAll(&quot;.scrolling-block&quot;);\n\nfunction scrollToSection(e, directionY, directionX) {\n  if (delay) return;\n  // console.log(e);\n  delay = true;\n\n  if (directionY !== 0) {\n    // if scroll by y\n    setTimeout(function () {\n      delay = false;\n    }, 1500);\n  } else {\n    // if scroll by x\n    delay = false;\n  }\n\n  if (directionY !== 0 || directionY !== -0) {\n    e.preventDefault();\n  }\n  if (directionY &gt; 0) {\n    //scroll down\n    if (counter + 1 !== sections.length) {\n      // scrollHeight += sections[counter].clientHeight;\n      counter++;\n    } else {\n      scrollHeight = scrollHeight;\n      counter = counter;\n    }\n    $(&quot;html,body&quot;).animate(\n      {\n        scrollTop: sections[counter].offsetTop,\n        behavior: &quot;smooth&quot;,\n      },\n      800\n    );\n\n    // console.log(scrollHeight + &quot;\\n&quot;, counter);\n    return counter;\n  } else if (directionY &lt; 0) {\n    //scroll up\n    if (counter - 1 !== -1) {\n      // scrollHeight -= sections[counter - 1].clientHeight;\n      counter--;\n    } else {\n      scrollHeight = scrollHeight;\n      counter = counter;\n    }\n\n    $(&quot;html,body&quot;).animate(\n      {\n        scrollTop: sections[counter].offsetTop,\n        behavior: &quot;smooth&quot;,\n      },\n      800\n    );\n\n    // console.log(scrollHeight);\n    return counter;\n  }\n}\n\nwindow.addEventListener(\n  &quot;wheel&quot;,\n  function (e) {\n    let directionY = e.deltaY;\n\n    let directionX = e.deltaX;\n\n    let maxY = sections[sections.length - 1].offsetTop;\n\n    if (pageYOffset &lt; maxY - 10) {\n      // console.log(scrollHeight, &quot; &lt; &quot;, maxY);\n      if (directionY !== 0) {\n        e.preventDefault();\n      }\n      scrollToSection(e, directionY, directionX);\n    } else {\n      if (pageYOffset &lt; maxY &amp;&amp; directionY &lt; 0) {\n        if (directionY !== 0) {\n          e.preventDefault();\n        }\n        scrollToSection(e, directionY, directionX);\n      }\n      // console.log(scrollHeight, &quot; &gt; &quot;, maxY);\n    }\n\n    // e.stopPropagation();\n  },\n  { passive: false }\n);\n</code></pre>\n","userId":1,"threadId":920,"question_id":64882387,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

{\n    trashIcon = event.target;\n    trashIcon.parentNode.parentNode.parentNode.removeChild(trashIcon.parentNode.parentNode);\n  });\n}\n\nfunction updateItems() {\n  let editIcon = document.querySelectorAll(\".fa-edit\");\n  // let targetText = document.querySelectorAll(\".tdEdit\");\n  editIcon[editIcon.length - 1].addEventListener(\"click\", event =&gt; {"body":"<p>I'm trying to make a tictactoe game using javascript.
